accessAnyoneDescription: Anyone with this link can view the report.
accessRestrictedDescription: Only users who are added can access this link.
addDescriptionToAttachment: Add a description for this attachment (up to 100 characters).
advancedAssessmentSwitchTitle:
Advanced Mode unlocks more tabs and features like uploads and confidence scores for detailed, customizable reports—recommended for third-party assessments.
For self-assessments, Quick Assessment is simpler and faster.
advancedSettingsDescription: In this section, you can configure additional settings for this question.
AIDisabled: AI advice generation is currently disabled. You won't be able to use this feature at this time.
allOfTheSelectedAssessmentsUse: All of the selected assessments use
allQuestionsHaveBeenAnswered: All questions in the <style>{{questionnaire}}</style> questionnaire have been answered.
allQuestionsInAllQuestionnaireHaveBeenAn: All questions in every questionnaire have been answered. You can now view insights or choose to review other questionnaires.
allQuestionsInThisQuestionnaireHaveBeenA: To have more accurate insights, you can complete other questionnaires as well.
allQuestonsMustBeAnsweredFirst: All questions must be answered first.
answerNeedApprove: The selected answer needs approval from an assessor.
answerRangeEmptyStateDetailed: Don’t worry! We made it easy for you. Just click the button below to create your first template.
answerRangeKitDesignerDescription: Before creating questionnaires and questions, you can set up templates for answer options in your kit. These templates make building questions faster and more efficient, and are available when you create new questions. Each template includes the number and title of the options, and the percentage each option contributes to the overall score.
answerRangeListEmptyState: No answer range has been created yet.
anyChangesInTheNumberOfOptionsForAPreExi: Any changes in the number of options for a pre-existing question
areYouSureYouWantDeleteThisAttachment: Are you sure you want to delete this attachment?
areYouSureYouWantDeleteThisItem: Are you sure you want to delete this item?
areYouSureYouWantDeleteThisMember: Are you sure you want to remove {{name}} from {{assessment}}?
areYouSureYouWantDeleteThisMemberInvited: Are you sure you want to cancel the invitation sent to {{name}} for this assessment?
areYouSureYouWantSkipThisQuestion: Your changes will be lost. Do you want to continue?
assessmentKitDescription: To assess the system's status, the {{title}} assessment kit is used. This kit measures {{attributesCount}} main indicators across {{subjectsLength}} topics, namely {{subjects}}, and reports each indicator's score in {{maturityLevelCount}} maturity levels. The kit consists of {{questionnairesCount}} questionnaires, each of which will be reviewed separately below.
AttributeEmptyStateDetailed: Don’t worry! We made it easy for you. Just click the button below to create your first attribute.
attributesKitDesignerDescription:
Attributes are the most critical components of an evaluation. The maturity level of an evaluation is determined based on the maturity levels of the subjects and by calculating their weighted average. Each subject consists of several attributes, and its score is derived from the weighted average of these attributes.
In this section, you can define the subjects relevant to your evaluation, add the necessary descriptions for them, and determine the weight of each subject in the final calculation of the evaluation's maturity level.
changeOrderHelper: Drag each item to change the order (This order is ascending)
contactUsIntroText: We’re here to help. If you didn’t find a kit that fits your needs, let us know what you're looking for.
createAnAssessmentWith: Create an assessment with your desired assessment kit, answer its questions, and view the insights.
createBasicSpaceCongratulation: Your space is ready! You can now invite team members and start creating assessments right away.
createLimitedAssessments: Can create a limited number of assessments.
createPremiumSpaceCongratulation: Your space has been successfully created. Please note that your premium space is temporarily active. We will contact you shortly. Kindly check your email for further details.
creator: Creator
deleteAttribute: Are you sure you want to delete this attribute?

Are you sure you want to delete this draft?
This action cannot be undone. All unsaved changes will be lost.
deleteExistingAssessments: Delete one or more existing assessments.

disclaimerDescription: This report was produced with an evidence-based evaluation approach and partially relies on the information provided by the interviewees. The findings of this report are not 100% certain. If the managers approve, the evaluation process will continue to examine the evidence more deeply and increase the confidence factor.
dslDownloadGuide: If you don’t have the appropriate Excel template, you can download it.
dslReadyToDownload: Your DSL is ready to download!
editorActionRestriction: You cannot perform other actions while the editor is active. Complete the current action by saving or canceling first.
emailDoesNotExistInApp: No user with the provided email was found. An invitation letter will be sent to this email. Once the user registers, they will automatically become a member of the space and be granted access to this assessment.
emailExistsInApp: The user with the provided email is not a member of the assessment space. Assigning them a role will automatically add them to the space.
emptyAnswerHistoryDescription:
Here you can see if any assessor has answered this question and what answer they chose.
If you don't see any answer, it means no assessor has answered this question so far.
emptyAnswerRange: No answer range has been created yet.
enterEmailOfTheUserYouWantToAdd: Enter the email address of the user you want to add.
evaluation_process: Evaluation process (How was this report built?)
evidenceIsLimited: Each evidence is limited to five attachments. If you need more, simply create a new evidence and continue.
expiredDueToNewAnswer: Insight has expired due to a new answer.
expiredDueToNewAnswers: Insights have expired due to new answers.
fillInAllRequired: Please fill in all sections first.

generateInsights.AIGeneratedNeedsApprovalDescription: This AI-generated insight may be inaccurate or misleading and needs approval from an assessor.
generateInsights.AIinsightIsApprovedDescription: The current insight is up-to-date and approved, but can be regenerated with AI if you'd like.
generateInsights.AIinsightIsExpiredDescription: This insight has expired due to new answers and must be approved, edited by an assessor, or regenerated with AI.
generateInsights.generatedByAppNeedsApprovalDescription: This insight is generated by {{title}} based on assessment results and needs to be approved or edited by an assessor.
generateInsights.generateInsightDescription: The insight can be written by an assessor or automatically generated by {{title}} based on the assessment results.
generateInsights.generateInsightViaAIDescription: The attribute insight can be generated using AI based on answers to impactful questions.
generateInsights.insightIsApprovedDescription: The current insight is up-to-date and approved, but can be regenerated if you'd like.
generateInsights.insightIsExpiredDescription: This insight has expired due to new answers and must be approved, edited by an assessor, or regenerated based on the latest results.
generateInsights.questionsArentCompleteSoAICantBeGenerate: Attribute insights can't be provided until all the assessment questions have been answered.
generateInsights.regenerateDescription: The current insight will be lost. Generate a new one?
generateInsights.regenerateViaAIDescription: The current insight will be lost. Generate a new one with AI?

generatingFinalReport: We’re generating your final report based on your responses to this assessment. This process may take a few minutes.
gettingThingsReady: We are getting things ready for you...
inOrderToViewSomeInsight: In order to view some insights, please first complete some questionnaires.
invalidEmail: Please enter a valid email address.
invitationSentSuccessfully: The invitation has been sent successfully.
kitCustomDefaultDataChanged: Default data has not been changed since the last update.

kitDesignerTab.generalDescription: Welcome to the Kit Designer. This section is your first step towards creating a software assessment kit. By completing the required information in this section, your kit will be created, and you can then proceed to customize the details of your kit, such as defining maturity levels, setting up subjects, creating questionnaires, and more.
kitDesignerTab.measuresKitDesignerDescription: To begin the assessment process, you first need to define the measures that will be used to evaluate each attribute. Measures represent specific indicators, criteria, or actions that contribute to the overall performance of an attribute. Defining them clearly ensures a structured and meaningful evaluation. By setting up your measures: You establish a consistent basis for scoring, align the evaluation with organizational goals or standards, and enable accurate analysis and visualization of performance impact. Once defined, these measures will be used in subsequent visualizations to highlight strengths, weaknesses, and areas for improvement. Please start by creating and organizing the measures relevant to your context.

kitErrorsTitle: Issues have been found in the kit and it cannot be released. Please resolve the issues and try again.
kitStructureDescription: This section displays a chart that maps every Subject—the main assessment areas—and their nested Attributes, the specific factors measured within each subject. Detailed explanations for each Subject and its Attributes appear in the tabs below.
kitStructureDescriptionWithoutChart: Each subject represents a core assessment domain within the kit, such as Software, Team, or Process. It contains a set of Attributes that highlight critical aspects of performance, quality, or maturity in that domain. Reviewing these attributes provides a structured understanding of the current state and helps identify improvement opportunities.
kitValidated: All good! The kit has been successfully validated and is ready to be released.
learnWhyThisIsUnavailable: Learn why this action is unavailable?
maturityLevelsDescription: In this assessment kit, there are {{maturityLevelCount}} different maturity levels, each defined in the table below. At the end of the assessment process, the maturity level of each indicator is determined.
maturityLevelsKitDesignerDescription:
Maturity levels are a structured way to assess and improve the development and capabilities of processes, systems, or organizations. Typically, these levels are part of a maturity model, which provides a framework for evaluating how well an entity is performing in a specific domain.
In this section, in addition to defining the various maturity levels, you need to establish the relationship between these levels and the criteria for achieving each maturity level based on the preceding levels.
maturityLevelsListEmptyStateDetailed: No maturity level at the moment? You can define new ones via this button!
measureEmptyStateDetailed: No measures in this kit so far? Create your first measure with one click!
metadataAreNotProvided: Parts of metadata are not provided.
metadataIsNotProvided: Part of metadata is not provided.
name: Name
needsToAddAttachments: Needs to add attachments (after being created)
noComment: No comment has been noted yet!
noEvidence: No evidence has been noted yet!
NoIssueFound: No questionnaire has the selected issue.
NoIssuesFound: No questionnaire has the selected issues.
noOptionAtTheMoment: No options for answer at the moment.
noQuestionAtTheMoment: No questions in this questionnaire at the moment.
noQuestionAvailableForThisMaturity: No question impacts this level of the attribute.
noQuestionHasBeenAnswered: This question has not been answered yet.
noQuestionsHaveBeenAnswered: No questions in the {{questionnaire}} questionnaire have been answered yet!
noSpaceHere: Oh! You don't have any space yet!
notificationEmptyState: Nothing new to see here yet!
oneFileOnly: You can only upload one file at a time.
optionsEmptyStateDetailed: Options are necessary to create questions! Create your first option here.
optionsImpactsDescription: Impact indicates how and to what extent the options of a question affect various attributes. This effect can vary across different maturity levels, meaning an option can have different impacts on multiple attributes at different maturity levels. The maximum impact weight of an option is 1.
optionsImpactsDisabled: You can't add a new impact until you've created options and attributes.
optionsImpactsEmptyState: No attribute is impacted by this question yet!
optionsImpactsEmptyStateDetailed: A question has to impact at least one attribute to be created and added to the questionnaire.
pleaseNoteThatThereAreSomeLimitations: Please note that there are some limitations for modifying the content of the kit, and currently, some changes are not supported. The unsupported cases include:
publishDescription: In this section, the content of the kit is automatically reviewed and validated. If no errors are found, you can release the kit and make it available. If there are any errors, you need to resolve them before the kit can be released.
question: Question
questionAndOptionsDescription: In this section, enter the question text and its options. If desired, you can also add a hint or additional explanation for the question in the 'hint' section. For easier input of options, you can create a new template and reuse it in other questions, or use templates that have been previously created.
questionnairesEmptyStateDetailed: Questionnaires are necessary to create questions! Create your first questionnaire here.
questionnairesKitDesignerDescription: Questionnaires provide a structure for organizing and categorizing various questions. By dividing an assessment into different questionnaires, evaluators who intend to use your kit can navigate and utilize your assessment more easily. Questions can be categorized in various ways, but the most common method is by topic. In this way, questions that are most similar in terms of the topic are grouped into one questionnaire. It is recommended that each questionnaire contains a maximum of 15 questions and a minimum of 3 questions.
questionnairesListEmptyState: No questionnaire has been created so far.
quickAssessmentModeDescription: Quick Assessment Mode shows only essential steps for faster completion and direct access to the final report — ideal for self-assessments.
quickAssessmentSwitchTitle:
Quick Assessment hides extra tabs for a faster experience. For full features, use Advanced Mode.
Switch modes?
reachedNumberOfAssessments: You’ve reached the maximum number of assessments allowed in the Basic space. To create a new assessment,
releaseNote: Note: All changes you make are saved automatically as a draft.
removeMemberExpertGroup: Are you sure you want to remove this member?

reportDocument.helpDescription: This chart shows how much each measure contributes to a specific attribute. The length of each bar reflects its impact, and the sum of all bars equals 100%. The colors help visualize how much each measure has positively or negatively influenced the attribute. Hovering over a bar reveals the exact percentage of gained or missed score. This breakdown allows you to quickly identify strengths and opportunities for improvement within each area.

reviewAdvice: Based on the goal setting established in the previous section, the responses to the questionnaires will be reviewed. From there, questions will be selected that directly align with the chosen goals, where improving these areas will have the most significant impact on achieving the defined objectives.
shareReportViaEmail: Share the report with new people via email...
shortTitleInfo: A very short title (a few characters) for addressing the product under assessment in reports.
simpleStart: A simple start, a smart choice.
someQuestionsHaveNotBeenAnswered: Some questions have not been answered, which may affect the accuracy of the insights.
spacePremiumInfo: Your space will be created for free and remain active temporarily. Payment details will be sent via email; without agreement, it will be deactivated.
spacesAreEssentialForCreating: Spaces are essential for creating and organizing your assessments. You can also collaborate with others by adding them to spaces.
subjectEmptyStateDetailed: No subjects in the kit so far? Create your first subject with one click!
subjectsKitDesignerDescription: Subjects are the most critical components of an evaluation. The maturity level of an evaluation is determined based on the maturity levels of the subjects and by calculating their weighted average. Each subject consists of several attributes, and its score is derived from the weighted average of these attributes. In this section, you can define the subjects relevant to your evaluation, add the necessary descriptions for them, and determine the weight of each subject in the final calculation of the evaluation's maturity level.
submitAnswerAutomaticallyAndGoToNextQues: Automatically go to the next question after submitting the answer.
successCreatedAssessmentMessage: For now, you're the only one who can see this assessment. You can grant access to others via the settings page.
suggestAnyAdvicesSoFar: No advice has been suggested so far!
theOptionSelectionIsDisabled: The option selection is disabled as long as the question is marked as not applicable.

validateReleaseTooltip: Your kit cannot be released until all errors are resolved.
viewTheWeightAndSubject: Here, you can view the weights of different subjects or attributes and adjust them as desired for this specific assessment.
weHighlyRecommendAnsweringMoreQuestions: We highly recommend answering more questions for more accurate and comprehensive insights.
weWillGetBackToYouSoon: We’ll get back to you as soon as possible.

whichAttYouWant: Decide how much you want each attribute to improve. The Advice Generator will identify which assessment questions require improvement and will provide recommendations based on those questions.
